## Discussion

Use the value and the unit together to determine the subscription period. For example, if the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Product/SubscriptionPeriod/unit-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Product/SubscriptionPeriod/Unit-swift.enum/month], and the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Product/SubscriptionPeriod/value] is `3`, the subscription period is three months.

# value

**Instance Property**

The number of period units.

## Declaration

```swift
let value: Int
```

## Discussion

Use the value and the unit together to determine the subscription period. For example, if the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Product/SubscriptionPeriod/unit-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Product/SubscriptionPeriod/Unit-swift.enum/month], and the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Product/SubscriptionPeriod/value] is `3`, the subscription period is three months.

## Getting the subscription period

- **unit**: The increment of time for the subscription period.
- **Product.SubscriptionPeriod.Unit**: Units of time that describe subscription periods.
